channel.title: Findings on UVA Biocomplexity Institute
channel.description: Recent content in Findings on UVA Biocomplexity Institute

item.title: Economics
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } Economic Profile The current maps represent an overview of the city of Petersburg, VA and as you see they have large economic disparities. As I direct your attention closer to the map on the right you will see there is High Amounts of residents living below the poverty line and only one area that has houses only 10% below the poverty line.

item.title: Health
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } Health Outcomes The city of Petersburg is currently ranked last for health outcomes in the state of Virginia. Obesity is at a all time high with 40% and Diabetes is at a high of 14.6% which you see the graphs on the right show just how high they are in comparison to the entire state and national percentages.

item.title: Transportation
item.description: Main Finding Local commuting score #### Driving #### Public Transit #### Biking #### Walking [walkability score] Conclusion and Policy Implications Keeping in mind that most of the city of petersburg lives below the poverty line we decided to take a look at the community options available. Most people preferred a car as there preferred means of transportation and in a household most owned at least one car. The average person in a household in the city is 2.

item.title: Crime and Policy
item.description: /* this chunnk of code centers all of the headings */ h1, h2, h3 { text-align: center; } Crime Keeping safety in mind we decided to take a look at the current state of the cityâ€™s crime. We found that the city of Petersburg,Va is currently ranked the most dangerous city in Virginia. The chart on the right hand side shows a breakdown of the type of crimes and their comparison to Virginia overall and the national stats.
